pr_title: Add uber-jar to the list of default packaging in the doc

timeline.bodyText:
Now that you mention it, I think it should be:
The built in types are 'jar', 'uber-jar', 'fast-jar' and 'native'
timeline.author: geoand
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
     /**
      * The requested output type.
      *
-     * The default built in types are jar and native
+     * The default built in types are jar, uber-jar and native

replies.bodyText:
fast-jar is intended to replace the jar type so, to not add to the confusion of too many deployment types, I think we should stick to jar, uber-jar and native.
Moreover, fast-jar is still experimental ...
replies.author: loicmathieu

replies.bodyText: Sure, but if it's not in the javadoc, it's harder for people to know it exists and therefore try out and provide feedback 😉
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
Still not convinced it's worth it as when fast-jar becomes the default someone woud need to remember to update the comment ...
And people will not understand what a fats-jar is ...
What about
The built in types are 'jar', 'fast-jar' (a prototype more performant version of the default 'jar' type), 'uber-jar' and 'native'
replies.author: loicmathieu

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/pkg/PackageConfig.java b/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/pkg/PackageConfig.java
index e0eeb6e5ee..d1320dff85 100644
--- a/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/pkg/PackageConfig.java
+++ b/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/pkg/PackageConfig.java

@@ -22,7 +22,8 @@ public class PackageConfig {
     /**
      * The requested output type.
      *
-     * The default built in types are jar, uber-jar and native
+     * The default built in types are 'jar', 'fast-jar' (a prototype more performant version of the default 'jar' type),
+     * 'uber-jar' and 'native'.
      */
     @ConfigItem(defaultValue = JAR)
     public String type;

timeline.message: Add uber-jar to the list of default packaging in the doc
Add uber-jar to the list of default packaging in the doc
